paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: BRCA2 c.2254_2257del p.(Asp752Phefs*19) is the most common variant, accounting for 11/55 (20%) BRCA2 variant findings in the cohort of young patients.
This variant has only been reported previously in a Palestinian patient.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a frameshift leading to a truncated protein.

variants.segregation_data: The variant co-occurs with c.5351dup in several patients, suggesting shared ancestry.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is recurrent and has been identified in multiple cohorts.
key_quotes: BRCA2 c.2254_2257del p.(Asp752Phefs*19) is the most common variant, accounting for 11/55 (20%) BRCA2 variant findings in the cohort of young patients.

patients.demographics: high-risk female patients, median age 39 years

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Five (six) of the patients, additionally carry BRCA2 c.5351dup p.(Asn1784Lysfs*3) in the first (second) cohort.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a frameshift leading to a truncated protein.

variants.additional_notes: This variant is recurrent and has been identified in multiple cohorts.
